title.narrative: Envelope 1: Life-saving Winter NFI Assistance to the Most Vulnerable People in Underserved Areas of Afrin District.

description.narrative:
The proposed action will deliver life-saving winter NFI assistance and address critical winter gaps for 15,000 acutely vulnerable people in Afrin sub-district, considered high priority for this allocation. Informed by recent market and need assessments, a cash-based solution to winter NFI needs is proposed to ensure maximum flexibility and dignity for beneficiaries and to support local markets and economies. The cash-based approach builds on Big Hearts extensive experience with Cash and Voucher Assistance (CVA) programming to meet winter, non-food, shelter, food and other needs, including multiple, successful SCHF funded actions including CVA.
One-off Winter Cash Top-ups of $150 per household will be distributed to total 3,000 highly vulnerable households from January to early March 2022 to protect thermal comfort and household wellbeing. This component complements Big Hearts ongoing winterization response funded by ECHO and IOM in neighboring areas of Afrin district and addresses gaps in the overall response identified through coordination with the SNFI cluster and other members. Winter assistance will be based on needs and target the most vulnerable households based on the eligibility and vulnerability criteria recommended in the cluster 'Guidance Note on Winterization for Northwest Syria' (updated August 2020). This will include 1,085 particularly vulnerable households with Pregnant or Lactating Women (PLW) currently targeted by Big Heart in partnership with UNICEF for repeat, cash assistance designed to improve nutrition outcomes through increasing economic access to food. Big Heart will coordinate closely with other FS actors, specifically Shafak, in targeted areas to ensure winter cash beneficiaries also receive complementary food security assistance from other actors. This is in line with Big Hearts integrated approach to winterization assistance and seeks to protect the cash transfer value for winter NFIs.
The cash-based approach to winter NFI needs has been informed by an extensive Needs Assessment completed by Big Heart in targeted areas of Afrin sub-district during November 2021. This included a market assessment, Key Informant Interviews (KIIs) and a household survey involving 238 respondents. The assessment confirmed local markets were accessible and able to respond to winter NFI needs and that lack of purchasing power represents the greatest barrier to meeting winter NFI needs.
The threat of the COVID 19 pandemic continues to be considered as a cross-cutting theme through-out the design of the action, as detailed under Section 3 (Link with Allocation Strategy).
